Cranberry-Walnut Oatmeal Energy Balls

posted Oct 25, 2023, by Shana Thomas

Jump to Recipe

Elevate your snacking game with these oatmeal energy balls, a perfect blend of cranberries, walnuts, and oats, crafted for a quick and tasty pick-me-up.

Welcome to our cozy kitchen, where we’re about to whip up something truly delightful for both your taste buds and well-being. Today, we’re diving into the world of Cranberry-Walnut Energy Oatmeal Bites. These little wonders are not just snacks; they’re like bites of sunshine crafted to brighten your day.

Ingredients

  1. Raw Walnuts: These hearty nuts add a delightful crunch and a hearty dose of healthy fats and omega-3s. They’re like tiny powerhouses of energy, ready to fuel your day.
  2. Sweetened Dried Cranberries: Bursting with tart sweetness, cranberries bring a burst of flavor and antioxidants to the mix. They’re like little jewels in your oatmeal crown.
  3. Pitted Dates: These naturally sweet gems not only bind our oatmeal balls but also offer a touch of caramel-like richness. It’s like a warm hug in every bite.
  4. Old-Fashioned Rolled Oats: Oats, the true champions of heart-healthy grains, provide the perfect base for our oatmeal balls. They’re like a cozy blanket of comfort.
  5. Tahini: This creamy sesame paste adds a nutty depth to our recipe, and it’s packed with essential minerals. It’s like the secret ingredient that ties everything together.
  6. Fresh Lemon Juice: A splash of zesty lemon juice brings a burst of freshness that cuts through the richness. It’s like a sunbeam in the kitchen.
  7. Pure Maple Syrup: A touch of maple syrup provides a hint of sweetness and a touch of nostalgia. It’s like a drizzle of love from the maple trees.

How to make these oatmeal energy balls

STEP 1

Begin by placing your raw walnuts, dried cranberries, and pitted dates in a food processor. Give them a whirl until they become finely chopped but still maintain some texture. It’s like creating the canvas for your masterpiece.

STEP 2

Add the old-fashioned rolled oats, tahini, fresh lemon juice, and pure maple syrup to the food processor. These ingredients join the party, creating a vibrant dance of flavors. Pulse everything until the mixture becomes sticky and easily forms into balls.

STEP 3

With clean hands, shape the mixture into bite-sized balls, like crafting your edible work of art. Place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

STEP 4

Let the oatmeal balls chill in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. This step is your chance to practice a bit of mindfulness. While they’re cooling, take a moment to savor the delightful anticipation of your delicious creation.

Worthy Tip: If you’re looking for a way to save, consider making a larger batch. These oatmeal balls are stored wonderfully in the freezer. You can have a supply of these energy bites ready to brighten your day whenever you need them.

Expert Tips:

Let’s dive into the process of creating these delectable oat energy balls step by step, with some expert tips to make them just right.

  1. The Dance of Texture: Crafting the perfect texture is like composing a symphony – walnuts provide a satisfying crunch, while the mixture maintains a soft, chewy consistency. Trust your instincts; the harmonious blend of flavors and textures will let your taste buds join in the joyful dance.
  2. Playful Variations: Embrace your inner chef and get creative by rolling these energy balls in shredded coconut, cocoa powder, or crushed nuts for added texture and visual appeal. Experiment with different dried fruits, like apricots or figs, to create personalized variations – it’s like a palette of flavors waiting to be explored.
  3. Storage is Key: Place these delightful energy balls in an airtight container in your fridge for safekeeping, and they’ll remain fresh for up to a week. You can also stock up by freezing extra batches to have a convenient and delicious pick-me-up ready whenever your heart desires

Frequently Asked Questions

Are energy bites good for you?

Absolutely! Energy bites are wholesome nuggets of vitality, providing a quick and sustained energy boost, perfect for any moment in your day. Customize them to your taste for a unique, energy-packed treat. These bite-sized wonders also support mindful snacking, offering both portion control and on-the-go convenience. They’re a delightful and nutritious addition to your wellness journey, delivering a taste of vitality in every bite!

How do you use an energy ball?

Using an energy ball is a breeze. When you need a tasty energy boost, grab one, savor the flavors, and enjoy it as a snack or treat. They’re perfect for any moment – pre-workout, post-dinner, or in between. Plus, you can prepare them in advance and keep them in the fridge for quick and healthy snacking.

How many energy balls can I eat a day?

You can enjoy one or two energy balls daily as a wholesome snack, providing a nice energy boost. Remember to consider your daily calorie intake and activity level for a balanced approach. Moderation is key, to ensuring guilt-free enjoyment of these delightful treats.

Do energy balls need to be refrigerated?

Concerning storage, whether or not to refrigerate energy balls depends on their intended shelf life. If you plan to enjoy them within a day or two, no need to chill them. But for longer freshness, store them in an airtight container in the fridge. With this method, they’ll stay good for up to two weeks.

Breakfast recipes to pair with oatmeal energy balls

  • Refreshing Strawberry Grapefruit Smoothie
  • Chocolate Raspberry Chia Pudding
  • Blackberry Waffles

If you’ve embraced the magic of these oatmeal energy balls in your kitchen, I’d love to hear about it – drop a comment or share your rating below, and don’t forget to join me on Instagram for plant-based recipes and wellness inspiration!

Cranberry-Walnut Oatmeal Energy Balls (No-Bake)

Shana Thomas
Indulge in these scrumptious no-bake Cranberry-Walnut Energy Balls, a delightful blend of sweet cranberries and brain-boosting walnuts. Crafted with love, these energy-packed wonders offer a quick and easy way to nourish your body, whether you're starting your day or need an on-the-go breakfast or snack. Satisfy your cravings with wholesome, bite-sized goodness – no baking required!
5 from 5 votes
Print Recipe Pin Recipe
Prep Time 10 minutes mins
Total Time 10 minutes mins
Course Appetizer, Dessert, Snack
Cuisine American
Servings 8
Calories 170 kcal

Ingredients
  

  • 3/4 cup raw walnuts
  • 1/2 cup sweetened dried cranberries
  • 1/4 cup pitted dates
  • 3/4 cup old-fashioned rolled oats
  • 2 tbsp tahini
  • 2 tbsp fresh lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp pure maple syrup

Instructions
 

  • Begin by placing your raw walnuts, dried cranberries, and pitted dates in a food processor. Give them a whirl until they become finely chopped but still maintain some texture. It's like creating the canvas for your masterpiece.
  • Add the old-fashioned rolled oats, tahini, fresh lemon juice, and pure maple syrup to the food processor. These ingredients join the party, creating a vibrant dance of flavors. Pulse everything until the mixture becomes sticky and easily forms into balls.
  • With clean hands, shape the mixture into bite-sized balls, like crafting your edible work of art. Place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  • Let the oatmeal balls chill in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. This step is your chance to practice a bit of mindfulness. While they're cooling, take a moment to savor the delightful anticipation of your delicious creation.

Notes

    • Variations: Get creative by rolling these energy balls in shredded coconut, cocoa powder, or crushed nuts for added texture and visual appeal. Experiment with different dried fruits, like apricots or figs, to create personalized variations.
    • Storage is Key: Place these delightful energy balls in an airtight container in your fridge for safekeeping, and they’ll remain fresh for up to a week. You can also stock up by freezing extra batches to have a convenient and delicious pick-me-up ready whenever your heart desires.
Keyword energy balls, energy bites, mediterranean diet desserts, oatmeal energy balls
